name: XEBEL 20001
description:
Note: Game loads on an empty screen for ~1-45 seconds. You may want to turn down your volume during this period. If the game does not load, refresh the page and try again.

This description is a work of fiction, however the controls and music credits are real.

This game is an emulation of a forty-four year old Gameboy cartridge discovered in a drawer in an abandoned office building. Faithfully recreated, it features everything from the original cartridge including:

  • Full sound
  • Score system
  • Advanced rendering

Along with the cartridge, a scrap of an instruction manual was found in an adjacent drawer. It read:

..[Y]ou can control your very own XEBEL 20001 spaceship! Press L and R on [t]he D-pad to maneuver side to side, and press the A [b]utton to laser-bounce off incoming death rays, but don't fall! Co[m]pete against your friends with the ne[w]...

(smudged or missing letters that have been replaced have been marked with a square brackets). The game included a feature that would let players bounce higher by double-tapping the A button that was not mentioned by the remaining section of the instructions manual. 

Controls have been condensed and emulated with:

Keyboard KeysFunctionOriginal Gameboy ButtonsArrow KeysMove the player side-to-sideD-PadXBounce (double tap to super-bounce)AZStart the game from the menu screenStart

Music is by xDeveruchi from https://xdeviruchi.itch.io/8-bit-fantasy-adventure-music-pack
